question: Wow.
Wow.
Wow.
answer: Yes, Marlin. No, I see it. It's beautiful.

question: So, Coral, when you said you wanted an ocean view, you didn't think that we we're gonna get the whole ocean, did you? Huh? Oh yeah. A fish can breath out here. Did your man deliver or did he deliver?
And it wasn't so easy.
answer: Because a lot of other clownfish had their eyes on this place.

question: You better believe they did--every single one of them.
answer: Mm-hmm. You did good. And the neighborhood is awesome.

question: So, you do like it, don't you?
answer: No, no. I do, I do. I really do like it. But Marlin, I know that the drop off is desirable with the great schools and the amazing view and all, but do we really need so much space?

question: Coral, honey, these are our kids we're talking about. They deserve the best. Look, look, look. They'll wake up, poke their little heads out and they'll see a whale! See, right by their bedroom window.
answer: Shhh, you're gonna wake the kids.

question: Oh, right. Right.
answer: Aww, look. They're dreaming. We still have to name them.

question: You wanna name all of 'em, right now? All right, we'll name this half Marlin Jr. and then this half Coral Jr. Okay, we're done.
Nemo? Well, we'll name one Nemo but I'd like most of them to be Marlin Jr.
answer: Just think that in a couple of days, we're gonna be parents!

question: Yeah. What if they don't like me?
No, really.
answer: There's over 400 eggs. Odds are, one of them is bound to like you. What?

question: You remember how we met?
Well, I remember. 'Excuse me, miss, can you check and see if there's a hook in my lip?'

Here he is. Cutie's here! Where did everybody go? Coral, get inside the house, Coral. No, Coral, don't. They'll be fine. Just get inside, you, right now. No! Coral! Coral? Coral? Oh! Ohh. There, there, there. It's okay, daddy's here. Daddy's got you. I promise, I will never let anything happen to you...Nemo.
answer: First day of school! First day of school! Wake up, wake up! C'mon, first day of school!

question: I don't wanna go to school. Five more minutes.
Okay...huh?
answer: Get up, get up! It's time for school! It's time for school! It's time for school! It's time for school! Oh boy! Oh boy!

question: All right, I'm up.
Nemo!
Nemo, don't move! Don't move! You'll never get out of there yourself. I'll do it. All right, where's the break? You feel a break?
Sometimes you can't tell 'cause fluid is rushing to the area. Now, any rushing fluids?
Are you woozy?
How many stripes do I have?
Answer the stripe question!
No! See, something's wrong with you. I have one, two, three--that's all I have? Oh, you're okay. How's the lucky fin?
Let's see. Are you sure you wanna go to school this year? 'Cause there's no problem if you don't. You can wait 5 or 6 years.
answer: Come on, dad. It's time for school.

question: Ah-ah-ah! Forgot to brush.
Do you want this anemone to sting you?
Brush.
You missed a spot.

There. Ha ha! Right there. And here and here and here! All right, we're excited. First day of school, here we go. We're ready to learn to get some knowledge. Now, what's the one thing we have to remember about the ocean?

That's my boy. So, first we check to see that the coast is clear. We go out and back in. And then we go out, and back in. And then one more time--out and back in. And sometimes, if you wanna do it four times--
All right. Come on, boy.
answer: Dad, maybe while I'm at school, I'll see a shark! Have you ever met a shark?

question: No, and I don't plan to.
Sea turtles? I don't know.
answer: Sandy Plankton from next door, he said that sea turtles, said that they live to be about a hundred years old!

question: Well, you know what, if I ever meet a sea turtle, I'll ask him. After I'm done talking to the shark, okay? Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hold on, hold on, wait to cross. Hold my fin, hold my fin.
answer: Dad, you're not gonna freak out like you did at the petting zoo, are you?

question: Hey, that snail was about to charge. Hmm, I wonder where we're supposed to go. Come on, we'll try over there. Excuse me, is this where we meet his teacher?
answer: Well, look who's out of the anemone.

question: Yes. Shocking, I know.
Marlin.
Well, actually, that's a common misconception. Clownfish are no funnier than any other fish.

All right, I know one joke. Um, there's a mollusk, see? And he walks up to a sea, well he doesn't walk up, he swims up. Well, actually the mollusk isn't moving. He's in one place and then the sea cucumber, well they--I mixed up. There was a mollusk and a sea cucumber. None of them were walking, so forget that I--
answer: Sheldon! Get out of Mr. Johansenn's yard, now!

question: ..mesopolagic, bathyal, abyssalpelagic. All the rest are too deep for you and me to see. Huh, I wonder where my class has gone? Oh, there you are. Climb aboard, explorers. Oh, knowledge exploring is oh so lyrical, when you think thoughts that are empirical.
Well, hello. Who is this?
Well, Nemo, all new explorers must answer a science question.
You live in what kind of home?
Bye, son! Be safe.
answer: Hey, you're doing pretty well for a first timer.

question: Well, you can't hold onto them forever, can you? They just gotta grow up--the drop off?! They're going to the drop off?! Wh-what are you, insane?! Why don't we fry 'em up now and serve them with chips!?
Don't tell me to be calm, pony boy!
Uh, my dad says it's not safe.
Dad?
answer: You were about to swim into open water!

question: No, I wasn't go out--but dad!
answer: It was a good thing I was here. If I hadn't showed up, I don't know--

question: No, I wasn't.
answer: This does not concern you, kids. And you're lucky I don't tell your parents you were out there. You know you can't swim well.

question: I can swim fine, dad, okay?
answer: No, it's not okay. You shouldn't be anywhere near here. Okay, I was right. You'll start school in a year or two.

question: No, dad! Just because you're scared of the ocean--
answer: Clearly, you're not ready. And you're not coming back until you are. You think you can do these things but you just can't, Nemo!

question: Oh! Nemo! Unh! Nemo! Nemo, no! Nemo! Nemo! Nemo! No! No! Aah! Nemo! Nemo! Oh no. No, no. It's gone, it's gone. No, no, it can't be gone. No, no! Nemo! Nemo! Nemo! No! Nemo! Nemo! No! No, please, no! No, no! Has anybody seen a boat!? Please! A white boat! They took my son! My son! Help me, please!
Waaaah! Ooh, ooh...
answer: Ohh. Oh, oh. Sorry! I didn't see you. Sir, are you okay?

question: He's gone, he's gone..
He's gone.
No, no. They took him away. I have to find the boat.
You have?
answer: It passed by not too long ago.

question: A white one?
Where!? Which way!?
answer: Oh, oh, oh! It-it went, um, this way! And it went this way! Follow me! No problem.

question: Hey! Wait!
What?
answer: I'm trying to swim here. What, ocean ain't big enough for you?

question: Huh?
answer: You got a problem, buddy? Huh? Huh? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? You want a piece of me? Yeah, oooh, I'm scared now. Whaat!?

question: Wait a minute..
What? You're showing me which way the boat went!
answer: A boat? Hey, I've seen a boat. It passed by not too long ago. It went this way, it went this way. Follow me!

question: Wait a minute, wait a minute! What is going on? You already told me which way the boat was going!
If this is some kind of practical joke, it's not funny! And I know funny..I'm a clownfish!
answer: No, it's not. I know it's not. I'm so sorry. See, I suffer from short-term memory loss.

question: Short-term memory loss..I don't believe this!
answer: No, it's true. I forget things almost instantly. It runs in my family..or at least I think it does. Hmmm..where are they? Can I help you?

question: How 'bout you, Chum?
answer: Oh, um, I seem to have misplaced my uh, friend.

question: That's all right, Chum. I had a feeling this would be a difficult step, you can help yourself to one of my friends.
answer: Oh, thanks, mate. A little chum for Chum, eh?

question: I'll start the testimonies. Hello, my name is Bruce. It has been three weeks since my last fish, on my honor, or may I be chopped up and made into soup.
answer: You're an inspiration to all of us.

question: Right, then. Who's next?
Yes, the little Sheila down the front.
Come on up here.
answer: Hi. I'm Dory. And, uh, well, I don't think I've ever eaten a fish.

question: I can't read human.
answer: Well then we gotta find a fish who can read this. Hey, look. Sharks!

question: No, no, no, Dory!
No, Dory!
answer: That's mine! Give it to me! Gimme! Oww!

question: Oh, I'm sorry. Are you okay?
I'm so sorry.
answer: You really clocked me there. Am I bleeding?

question: Ohh...
There's no way out! There's got to be a way to escape!
Dory, help me find a way out!
answer: Sorry, you'll have to come back later. We're trying to escape.

question: There's gotta be a way out!
answer: Look, here's something! 'ESSS-CA-PE'! I wonder what that means. It's funny, it's spelled just like the word 'escape'.

question: Barbara?
Prep for his anterior crown, would you, please? And I'm going to need a few cotton rolls.
Ah, the ocean. The ocean! Aaah! He hasn't been decontaminated yet! Jacques!
Clean him!
Ocean!
answer: Ooh, la mer. Bon. Voila. He is clean.

question: Oooh, he's using a Hedstrom file.
answer: That's not a Hedstrom file. That's a K-Flex.

question: It's got a teardrop cross-section. Clearly a Hedstrom.
Hedstrom!
Hey, Nigel.
answer: What did I miss? Am I late?

question: Root canal and it's a doozy.
answer: Root canal, eh? What did he use to open?

question: Gator-Glidden drill.
answer: He seems to be favoring that one. Hope he doesn't get surplus sealer at the portal terminus... hello. Who's this?

question: Nemo. Nemo.
answer: Are you gonna eat that? Careful with that hammer...

question: Huh? No, no! What does it say? Dory!
Wake up! Get up! Come on! Come on!
answer: Yes, I'm a natural blue... Look out! Sharks eat fish! Aaaaaah! Wow. Dusty.

question: The mask! Where's the mask? No! No, not the mask! Get it! Get the mask! Get the mask! Get it!
answer: Hoo doot doo doot doot doo doot. Whoo-hoo! La la la la la la. Just keeps going on, doesn't it? Echo! Echo! Hey, what are you doing?

question: It's gone. I've lost the mask.
You dropped it! That was my only chance of finding my son, now it's gone.
answer: Hey, Mr. Grumpy Gills. When life gets you down, you know what you gotta do?

question: I don't wanna know what you gotta do when life gets you down.
answer: Just keep swimming. Just keep swimming, swimming, swimming. What do we do? We swim, swim.

question: Dory, no singing.
answer: Ho ho ho ho ho ho! I love to swim! When you want to swim..

question: See, I'm going to get stuck now with that song now it's in my head!
Dory, do you see anything?
That was me. I'm sorry.
Who could it be? It's me!
Yeah, yeah. I'm your conscience. We haven't spoken for a while. How are you?
Yeah? Good. Now, Dory. I want you to tell me..do you see anything?
A light.
answer: Yeah. Over there. Hey, conscience. Am I dead?

question: No, I see it too. What is it?
I'm feeling...happy. Which is a big deal for me.
answer: I want to touch it. Oh!

question: Hey, come back. Come on back here.
answer: I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna swim with you.

question: I'm gonna get you. I'm gonna be your best friend...good feeling's gone. I can't see! I don't know where I'm going!
The mask!
answer: What mask? Okay, I can't see a thing.

question: Oh, gee!
Read it!
answer: I'm sorry, but if you could just bring it a little closer, I kind of need the light. That's great, keep it right there.

question: Just read it!
answer: Okay, okay. Mr. Bossy. Uh, 'P'. Okay, 'P'. 'Shh-eer...Sher--P. Sher--P. Shirley? P.--'. Oh! The first line's 'P. Sherman'!

question: P. Sherman doesn't make any sense!
Don't eat me! Don't eat me! Aaaah!
Waah! Waaah! Waaaah!
That's great! Speed read! Take a guess! No pressure! No problem! There's a lot of pressure! Pressure! Take a guess now with pressure!
Duck!
I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I'm dead, I died, I'm dead. Whoo-hoo! We did it, we did it! Oh yeah, yeah, yeah! No eating here tonight, whoo! Dory.
answer: No, no, no eating here tonight. You on a diet--

question: Dory! What did the mask say?
answer: 'P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney'. I remember what it said! I usually forget things, but I remembered it this time!

question: Whoa, whoa, wait! Where is that?
answer: I don't know. But who cares? I remembered! P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. I remembered it again!

question: Psst. Nemo.
Nemo.
'Cause we've got him.
You see that filter?

I'm going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where are you going? I'm going to P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. If you're askin' where I'm goin'. I'll tell you that's where I'm going. It's P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Where? I'm sorry, I didn't hear you. P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way...
answer: Excuse me. Ex-excuse me, um, hi. Do you know how to get to--hello? W-w-w-wait! Can you tell me--hey! Hold it! Wait a minute! I'm trying to talk to you. Okay, fellas, come back here. Please, one quick question. I need to aaaaand they're gone again.

question: P. Sherman 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney. Why do I have to tell you over and over again? I'll tell you again. I don't get tired of it--
Huh?
answer: Here's the thing. Y'know, I just, I-I think it's best if I just, if I just, carry on from here by..by myself.

question: Okay.
Uh-huh.
answer: Without, without..well, I mean, not without you. I mean, it's just that I don't want you... with me.

question: Huh?
answer: I don't wanna hurt your feelings..

question: You want me to leave?
answer: Well, I mean not..yes, yeah. It's just that you know I-I just can't afford anymore delays and you're one of those fish that cause delays. And sometimes it's a good thing. There's a whole group of fish. They're..'delay fish'.

question: You mean.. you mean you don't..like me?
answer: No, of course I like you. It's because I like you I don't wanna be with you. It's a complicated emotion. Oh, don't cry. I like you.

question: Look, pal. We're talkin' to the lady, not you. Hey-hey, you like impressions?
Okay. Just like in rehearsals, gentlemen. So, what are we? Take a guess.
answer: Oh, oh, I've seen one of those.

question: I'm a fish with a nose like a sword.
Thank you.
answer: Oh dear. Hey, hey come back! Hey, what's the matter?

question: What's the matter? While they're doing their silly little impressions, I am miles from home, with a fish that can't even remember her own name.
Yeah. Meanwhile my son is out there.
Nemo.
But it doesn't matter, 'cause no fish in this entire ocean is gonna help me.
answer: Well, I'm helping you. Wait right here. Hey, guys.

question: Well, I'm helping you. Wait right here. Hey, guys.
answer: What, is he bothering you again?

question: No, no, he's a good guy. Go easy on him, he's lost his son, Fabio. Any of you heard of P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney?
answer: Sydney? Oh sure. Why, Ted here's got relatives in Sydney. Don't you, Ted?

question: Oh, hey! They know Sydney! You wouldn't know how to get there, would you?
answer: What you wanna do is follow the EAC, that's the East Australian Current. Big current, can't miss it, it's in..that direction. And then you gotta follow that for about, I don't know, what do you guys think? About three leagues? And that little baby's gonna put you right past Sydney.

question: Don't mention it. And, uh, loosen up. Okay, buddy?
answer: Oh, you guys. You really nailed him. Bye.

question: Oh, hey ma'am, one more thing.
When you come to this trench, swim through it, not over it.
answer: Trench, through it, not over it. I'll remember. Hey, hey! Hey! Hey! Hey, wait up, partner. Hold on. Wait! Wait-wait! I got, I gotta tell you something..whoa. Nice trench. Hello! Okay, let's go.

question: Trench, through it, not over it. I'll remember. Hey, hey! Hey! Hey! Hey, wait up, partner. Hold on. Wait! Wait-wait! I got, I gotta tell you something..whoa. Nice trench. Hello! Okay, let's go.
answer: Bad trench, bad trench. Come on, we're gonna swim over this thing.

question: Whoa, whoa, partner. Little red flag goin' up. Somethin's telling me we should swim through it, not over it.
answer: Are you even looking at this thing? It's got death written all over it.

question: I'm sorry, but I really, really, really think we should swim through.
answer: And I'm really, really done talking about this. Over we go.

question: Come on, trust me on this.
Yes, trust. It's what friends do.
answer: Look! Something shiny! Oh, it just swam over the trench. Come on, we'll follow it.

question: Okay. Boy, sure is clear up here.
answer: Exactly. And look at that, there's the current. We should be there in no time.

question: Hey, little guy.
answer: You wanted to go through the trench.

question: I shall call him Squishy and he shall be mine and he shall be my Squishy. Come here, Squishy. Come here, little Squishy. ---oww!
Bad Squishy! Bad Squishy!
answer: Shoo! Shoo, shoo! Get away! Come here, let me see.

question: Don't touch it! Don't touch it!
answer: I'm not gonna touch it. I just wanna look.

question: Heeey, how come it didn't sting you?
Ow! Ow, oww!
answer: ..hold still. I live in this anemone and I'm, I'm, I'm used to these kind of stings. Come here.

question: Ow, ow! Oww!
answer: It doesn't look bad, you're gonna be fine. But now we know, don't we?

question: Yeah.
answer: That we don't wanna touch these again. Let's be thankful this time it was just a little one. Don't move! This is bad, Dory.

question: Hey, watch this! Boing! Boing!
Boing-boing-boing! You can't catch me!
answer: Dory! Don't bounce on the tops! They will..not sting you. The tops don't sting you, that's it!

question: Ooh! Two in a row, beat that.
answer: Dory! All right, listen to me. I have an idea, a game.

question: A game?
A game?
Aah! I love games! Pick me!
answer: All right, here's the game. Um, whoever can hop the fastest out of these jellyfish, wins.

question: Okay!
Okay!
answer: You can't touch the tentacles, only the tops.

question: Something about tentacles, got it. On your mark, get set, go!
answer: W-wait! Wait! Not something about them, it's all about them! Wait!

question: Weeee!
Gotta go faster if you wanna win!
Boing! Boing! Boing-boing-boing-boing!
Weeee!
answer: So, we're cheating death now. That's what we're doin'. We're havin' fun at the same time. I can do this, just be careful.

question: Yeah, careful I don't make you cry when I win!
Ha ha ha ha! Whooo! Give it up, old man. You can't fight evolution, I was built for speed.
answer: The question is, Dory, are you hungry?

question: Huh? Hungry?
answer: Yeah, 'cause you're about to eat my bubbles! Duck to the left! Right there! The clownfish is the winner! Woohoo! We did it! We're gonna...Dory? Oh no. Dory! Dory! Dory! Dory! Uggghhh!

question: Ugh...am I disqualified?
answer: No, you're doing fine! You're, you're actually winning! But you gotta stay awake. Uh, where does P. Sherman live?

question: P..Sherman..Wallaby Way...Sydney...
answer: That's it! Oww! Ow! Stay awake! Stay awake! Ow! Stay awake! Stay--awake!

question: Awake...P..Sherman..
..42 Wallaby Way...
You miss your dad, don't you, Sharkbait?
Well, you're lucky to have someone out there who's lookin' for you.
answer: He's not looking for me. He's scared of the ocean.

question: Keep on him. My first escape, landed on dental tools. I was aimin' for the toilet.
All drains lead to the ocean, kid.
answer: Wow. How many times have you tried to get out?

question: Okay, you gotta be quick. Once you get in, you swim down to the bottom of the chamber and I'll talk you through the rest.
Go on, it'll be a piece of kelp. Nicely done! Can you hear me?
Here comes the pebble. Now, do you see a small opening?
Okay, inside it you'll see a rotating fan. Very carefully, wedge that pebble into the fan to stop it turning.
Careful, Sharkbait.
Stay calm, kid! Just don't panic!
Sharkbait! Grab hold of this!
Dude.
Dude. Focus, dude. Dude.
Oh, he lives! Hey, dude!
Oh, saw the whole thing, dude. First you were like, 'whoa'! And then we were all like, 'whoa'! And then you were like, 'whoa'.
You, mini-man. Takin' on the jellies. You got serious thrill issues, dude.
Awesome.
Oh, man. No hurlin' on the shell, dude, okay, just waxed it.
Whoa, dude. Mr. Turtle is my father. Name's Crush.
answer: Crush? Really? Okay Crush, listen I need to get to the East Australian Current. EAC?

question: Ha ha ha, dude, ha ha, you're ridin' it, dude! Check it out! Okay, grab shell, dude!
Ha ha! Righteous! Righteous! Yeah!
So, what brings you on this fine day to the EAC?
answer: Well, Dory and I need to get to Sydney. Dory! Dory! Is she all right!?

question: Oh. Oh, Little Blue. She is sub-level, dude.
Dory, Dory! Dory!
Oh, Dory. I-I-I'm so sorry. This is all my fault, it's my fault...
answer: ..29, 30! Ready or not, here I come! There you are! Catch me if you can! Ha ha! Ha ha ha ha!

question: Whoa. Kill the motor, dude. Let us see what Squirt does flying solo.
answer: Whoa! Whoa! That was so cool! Hey dad, did you see that? Did you see me? Did you see what I did?

question: You so totally rock, Squirt! So give me some fin..noggin.. Oh, intro. Jellyman, Offspring. Offspring, Jellyman.
Ow.
answer: Curl away, my son. Aw, it's awesome, Jellyman. Little dudes are just eggs, leave 'em on the beach to hatch, then coo-coo-ca-choo, they find their way back to the big 'ol blue.

question: All by themselves?
But-but-but dude, how do you know when they're ready?
answer: Well, you never really know. But when they'll know, you'll know, you know? Ha.

question: Oh, would you just shut up! You're rats with wings!
answer: ..bloke's been lookin' for his boy Nemo.

question: Nemo?
answer: He was taken off the reef by divers and this..

question: Oh yeah. He's travelled hundreds of miles. He's been battling sharks and jellyfish and all sorts of--
Are you sure? What was his name? Some sort of sportfish or something
That's it! Marlin! The little clownfish from the reef.
answer: It's my dad! He took on a shark!

question: That took guts, kid.
No cleaning.
Hundred and fifty! Hundred and fifty, I gotta remember that.
Yup.
Yup. We're gonna just swim straight.
answer: Just keep swimming, just keep swimming.

question: Dory? Boy, this is taking a while.
answer: Hey, how about we play a game?

question: Okay.
answer: Uh, okay. I'm thinking of something, uh, orange. And it's small..

question: It's me.
It's me.
answer: All righty, Mr. Smarty Pants. ..orange and small, and white stripes..

question: Me. And the next one's just a guess
W-w-wait, I have definitely seen this floating speck before. That means we've passed it before and that means we're going in circles and that means we're not going straight!
We gotta get to the surface, come on! Let's figure it out up there. Let's go! Follow me! Wha--?
answer: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Hey! Relax. Take a deep breath. Now, let's ask somebody for directions.

question: Oh, fine. Who do you wanna ask, the speck? There's nobody here!
answer: Well, there has to be someone. It's the ocean, silly, we're not the only two in here. Let's see...okay, no one there. Uhh, nope. Nada. There's somebody. Hey! Excuse--

question: Dory! Dory! Dory! Okay, now it's my turn. I'm thinking of something dark and mysterious. It's a fish we don't know. And if we ask it directions, it could ingest us and spit out our bones!
answer: What is it with men and asking for directions?

question: Look, I don't wanna play the gender card right now. You wanna play a card? Let's play the 'Let's Not Die' card.
answer: You wanna get outta here, don't you?

question: Of course, I do.
answer: Well then, how are we gonna do that unless we give it a shot and hope for the best? Hmmm? Hmmmm!? Come on, trust me on this.

question: All right.
answer: Excuse me! Woohoo! Little fella? Hello. Don't be rude, say 'hi'.

question: Ha..hello.
Nemo.
Sydney. Dory, I'm a little fella. I don't think that's a little fella.
answer: Oh. Oh, oh, big fella. Big fe--whale. Okay. Maybe he only speaks whale.

question: Uh, Dory..what're you doing? What're you doing? Are you sure you speak whale? Dory! Heaven knows what you're saying! See, he's swimming away.
He's not coming back. You offended him.
answer: Maybe a different dialect. MOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! MOOOOOAAAAAAAAAA..!

question: Dory. Dory, this is not whale. You're speaking like..upset stomach.
No, don't try humpback.
Okay, you actually sound sick.
Don't do that!
answer: Too much orca. Didn't it sound a little orca-ish?

question: It doesn't sound orca! It sounds like nothing I've ever heard!
It's just as well, he might be hungry.
answer: Don't worry. Whales don't eat clownfish, they eat krill. Oh, look. Krill.

question: Move, Dory! Move!
Nine o' clock and cue dentist.
Okay. Okay, here we go. Here we go, okay.
He he! Did you hear that, Sharkbait?
answer: Yay! He's gonna clean the tank! He's gonna clean the tank! We're gonna be clean!

question: Are you ready to see your dad, kid?
Of course you are. Y'know, I wouldn't be surprised if he's out there in the harbor waitin' for you right now.
Aaaaaaaaaaaah! Ooof!
Aaaaaaaaaaaah!
answer: Here comes a big one--whooooooo! Come on, you gotta try this!

question: Would you just stop it!?
We're in a whale! Don't you get it!?
A whale! 'Cause you had to ask for help! And now we're stuck here!
answer: Wow. A whale. You know I speak whale.

question: No, you're insane! You can't speak whale! I have to get out! I have to find my son! I have to tell him how old sea turtles are!
answer: Woo-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-hoo! Hey. You okay? There, there. It's all right. It'll be okay.

question: No. No, it won't.
No. I promised him I'd never let anything happen to him.
answer: Huh. That's a funny thing to promise.

question: What?
answer: Well, you can't never let anything happen to him. Then nothing would ever happen to him. Not much fun for little Harpo. Hmm..

question: What's going on?
answer: I don't know. I'll ask him. MMMWWHAAAAAAAAA! HUUUWHAAAAAAAAA..

question: Dory. Dory. Dory.
answer: ..OOOOOOOOONNN? I think he says we've stopped.

question: Of course, we've stopped. Just stop trying to speak whale, you're gonna make things worse. What is that noise? Oh no. Look what you did. The water's going down! It's-it's-it's going down!
Look, it's already half-empty!
Stop that! It's half-empty!
answer: Okay, that one was a little tougher. He either said we should go to the back of the throat or he wants a root beer float.

question: Of course he wants us to go there! That's eating us! How do I taste, Moby!? Huh!? Do I taste good!? You tell him I'm not interested in being lunch!
Stop talking to him--waaaah!
What is going on!?
No! No more whale! You can't speak whale!
No, you can't! You think you could do these things but you can't, Nemo!
Dory!
answer: He says it's time to let go! Everything's gonna be all right! I don't!

question: Ha ha ha! We're alive!
answer: Look! Sy-d-ney..Sydney! Uh, Sydney! Sydney again!

question: You were right, Dory! We made it! We're gonna find my son! THAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANK-YOOOOOOOOOOOOOUUUU-SIIIRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!
answer: Wow. I wish I could speak whale.

question: Okay. All we gotta do is find the boat that took him.
I'm thinkin', I'm thinkin'.
Nemo!
Hold on! I'm comin'!
All right, do any of these boats look familiar to you?
answer: No, but the boat has to be here somewhere! Come on, Dory, we're gonna find it.

question: I'm totally excited. Are you excited?
answer: Dory, wake up, wake up. Come on.

question: Duck!
answer: That's not a duck. It's a--pelican! Whooooaaaaah!

question: Aaaaaaaaaaaah!
answer: No! I didn't come this far to be breakfast!

question: Love a duck!
answer: I gotta find my son Nemo! Dory, keep going! He's crazy!

question: I got something to tell 'ya! Okay, don't make any sudden moves. Hop inside my mouth if you want to live.
answer: Hop in your mouth, huh? And how does that make me live?

question: Because I can take you to your son.
No. I know your son. He's orange, he's got a gimpy fin on one side..
All right, let's see those pearly whites.
answer: RAAAH! I'm a piranha. They're in the Amazon.

question: And a piranha's a fish, just like your present.
answer: I get a fishy! Fishy, fishy, fishy!

question: Aaaaaaaaaaaah!
answer: What the--!? Darla, sweetie! Look out!

question: Aaaaaaaah!
Aaaaaaaah!
Aaaaaaaah!
answer: Hold still! Nobody's going to hurt you! Oof!

question: Hey..
answer: Dory. If it wasn't for you, I never even would have made it here. So, thank you.

question: Hey! Hey, wait a minute. W-w-wait! Where are you going?
answer: It's over, Dory. We were too late. Nemo's gone and I'm going home now.

question: No..no, you can't! Stop! Please don't go away. Please? No one's ever stuck with me for so long before. And if you leave, if you leave...I just, I remember things better with you. I do. Look, P. Sherman, 42..40..2..agh! I remember it, I do. It's there, I know it is because when I look at you, I can feel it. And I, I look at you and...I'm home. Please. I don't want them to go away. I don't wanna forget.
answer: I'm sorry, Dory, but I do.

question: Dad! Dad! Dad!
Um, excuse me. Are you all right?
answer: I don't know where I am! I don't know what's going on, I think I lost somebody but I, I can't remember.

question: It's okay, it's okay. I'm looking for someone too. Hey, we can look together.
I'm Nemo.
Dad!
Dad!
answer: Dad! Wait a minute, is it your dad or my dad?

question: My dad.
Where are we, anyway?
answer: Dad! Dad! Oh. S-ss-syl--shi--Sydney. 'P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney'. Aaaaah! Nemo! It's you! Aaaaaah! You're Nemo!

question: Yes! Yes! I'm Nemo!
answer: Oh! You're Nemo! You were dead! I saw you! And then I-- , here you are! I found you! You're not dead! And your father-- ! Your father!

question: My father!? You know my father!? Where is he!?
answer: This way! He went this way! Quick! Hey! Hey, hey! Hey! Hey! Have you seen an orange fish swim by? It looks just like him!

question: Sorry. Just trying to get home.
Nemo?
Nemo?
Dory? Nemo!
Nemo! I'm coming, Nemo!
Nemo!
No, no, no! No! Dory!
answer: Dad! I know what to do!

question: Nemo! No!
answer: We have to tell all the fish to swim down together!

question: Get out of there, now!
No, I am not gonna lose you again!
answer: Dad, there's no time! It's the only way we can save Dory! I can do this!

question: You're right. I know you can.
Now go! Hurry!
answer: Tell all of the fish to swim down!

question: Well!? You heard my son! Come on!
answer: Dory! You have to tell everybody to..

question: Just keep swimming! Keep swimming!
You're doing great, son!
Dory! Where's Nemo!? Oh no. Nemo! Nemo? Nemo? It's okay. Daddy's here, daddy's got you.
Oh, thank goodness.
No, no, no. I'm so sorry, Nemo. Hey, guess what?
Sea turtles? I met one! And he was a hundred and fifty years old.
Yep.
answer: 'Cause Sandy Plankton said they only live to be a hundred.

question: Sandy Plankton? Do you think I would cross the entire ocean and not know as much as Sandy Plankton!?
He was a hundred and fifty! Not one hundred! Who is this Sandy Plankton who knows everything? Time for school! Time for school! Get up! Let's go! Go! I'm gonna win!
answer: No, you're not! I did it! Woohoo! Ha ha ha!

question: Bye, son! Have fun!
answer: Bye, dad! Oh! Oh, Mr. Ray! Wait. I forgot something. Love you, dad.

question: I love you too, son.
answer: Uh, dad, you can let go now.
